name: Dublin Chamber of Commerce
goal: Dublin Chamber is the largest chamber of commerce in Ireland with over 1,300 member companies. It is the most representative and broadly-based business group in the Greater Dublin Area, providing representation and networking services. Its policy work focuses on developing the Dublin regionâ€™s infrastructure & transport, promoting competitiveness and improving local governance. Dublin Chamber is also one of the oldest chambers of commerce in the world, tracing its origins back to 1782.
interests: Enterprise, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: The Irish and Dublin economy has been transformed since EU membership. The national legislative process has also been transformed by EU membership and the expansion of competencies. In this context, the Chamber is focused on issues that are of national interest as they are effected by EU policy development out of the European Council, Parliament and Commission.
